words.def: located on the side facing away from the axis.
words.name: Abaxial

words.def: located on the side facing towards the axis.
words.name: Adaxial

words.def: opening at maturity
words.name: Dehiscent

words.def: outgrowth on the surface caused by invasion by other lifeforms, such as parasites
words.name: Gall

words.def: not opening at maturity
words.name: Indehiscent

words.def: web-like or network-like
words.name: Reticulate

words.def: marked by a series of lines, grooves, or ridges
words.name: Striated

words.def: marked by a pattern of polygons, usually rectangles
words.name: Tesselate

words.def: any flat surfaced structure emerging from the side or summit of an organ; seeds, stems.
words.name: Wing (plant)

words.def: the leaves and inflorescence rise from the ground, appearing to have no stem.
words.name: Acaulescent

words.def: plants with acid saps, normally due to the production of ammonium salts (malic and oxalic acid)
words.name: Acid plant

words.def: the period when the plant or population is at its maximum vigor.
words.name: Acme

words.def: parts of plants that are radially symmetrical in arrangement.
words.name: Actinomorphic

words.def: growing into a tree-like habit, normally with a single woody stem.
words.name: Arborescent

words.def: growing uprightly, in an upward direction, heading in the direction of the top.
words.name: Ascending

words.def: growth ascending.
words.name: Assurgent

words.def: dividing into multiple smaller segments.
words.name: Branching

words.def: falling away early.
words.name: Caducous

words.def: with a well-developed stem above ground.
words.name: Caulescent

words.def: forming dense tufts, normally applied to small plants typically growing into mats, tufts or clumps.
words.name: Cespitose

words.def: growing along the ground and producing roots at intervals along surface.
words.name: Creeping

words.def: falling away after its function is completed.
words.name: Deciduous

words.def: growth starts off prostrate and the ends become upright.
words.name: Decumbent

words.def: bending downward.
words.name: Deflexed

words.def: Growing for a limited time, floral formation and leaves (see also Indeterminate).
words.name: Determinate growth

words.def: of two different forms.
words.name: Dimorphic

words.def: a plant assumed to be adapted to a specific habitat.
words.name: Ecad

words.def: variation in plants due to conditions out side of the plants.
words.name: Ectogenesis

words.def: a parasitic plant that has most of its mass outside of the host, the body and reproductive organs of the plant lives outside of the host.
words.name: Ectoparasite

words.def: occurring on the ground.
words.name: Epigean

words.def: plants with stolons on the surface of the ground.
words.name: Epigeic

words.def: on the ground. Used for leaf fungus that live on the surface of the leaf.
words.name: Epigeous

words.def: growing on the surface of rocks.
words.name: Epilithic

words.def: an organism that grows on the bark of trees.
words.name: Epiphloedic

words.def: growing on the leaves. For example, Helwingia japonica has epiphyllous flowers (ones that form on the leaves).[5]
words.name: Epiphyllous

words.def: having the nature of an epiphyte.
words.name: Epiphytic

words.def: a plants that has flowers that open and close at definite times during the day.
words.name: Equinoctial

words.def: having an essentially upright vertical habit or position.
words.name: Erect

words.def: plant originally under cultivation that has become wild, garden plant growing in natural areas.
words.name: Escape

words.def: remaining green in the winter or during the normal dormancy period for other plants.
words.name: Evergreen

words.def: living in rivers and streams.
words.name: Eupotamous

words.def: normally living in salt water but tolerant of variable salinity rates.
words.name: Euryhaline

words.def: tolerant of a wide range of temperature.
words.name: Eurythermous

words.def: confined to specific location.
words.name: Exclusive species

words.def: not native to the area or region.
words.name: Exotic

words.def: a dried plant, most often used for specimens in a herbarium.
words.name: Exsiccatus

words.def: Inflorescence and leaves growing for an indeterminate time, until stopped by other factors such as frost (see also Determinate).
words.name: Indeterminate growth

words.def: non upright, growth not strictly upright or hangs down from the point of origin.
words.name: Lax

words.def: using another plant as a source of nourishment.
words.name: Parasitic

words.def: flowering before the leaves emerge.
words.name: Precocious

words.def: growing prostrate or trailing but not rooting at the nodes.
words.name: Procumbent

words.def: lying flat on the ground, stems or even flowers in some species.
words.name: Prostrate

words.def: creeping.
words.name: Repent

words.def: like a rosette (cf. rostellum).
words.name: Rostellate

words.def: arranged into a rosette.
words.name: Rosulate

words.def: an elongated, slender branch that roots at the nodes or tip.
words.name: Runner

words.def: plants produce stolons.
words.name: Stoloniferous

words.def: Not growing perfectly straight.
words.name: Semi-erect

words.def: somewhat shrubby, or shrubby at the base.
words.name: Suffrutescent

words.def: Growing upward.
words.name: Upright

words.def: wand-like, slender erect growing stem with many leaves or very short branches.
words.name: Virgate

words.def: forming secondary growth laterally around the plant so as to form wood.
words.name: Woody

words.def: plants that live, reproduce and die in one growing season.
words.name: Annual

words.def: plants that need two growing seasons to complete their life cycle, normally vegetative growth the first year and flowering the second year.
words.name: Biennial

words.def: see herbaceous.
words.name: Herbs

words.def: non-woody plants that live for more than two years and the shoot system dies back to the soil level each year.
words.name: Herbaceous perennial

words.def: true shrubs and trees or some vines with shoot systems that remain alive above the soil surface from one year to the next.
words.name: Woody perennial

words.def: plants that live for a number of years then after flowering and seed set die.
words.name: Monocarpic

words.def: the way in which an individual leaf is folded within an unopened bud.
words.name: Ptyxis

words.def: the arrangement of leaves in an unopened bud.
words.name: Vernation

words.def: roots that form from other than the hypocotyl or from other roots. Roots forming on the stem are adventitious.
words.name: Adventitious

words.def: roots growing in the air.
words.name: Aerial

words.def: the place where the roots and stem meet, which may or may not be clearly visible.[10]
words.name: (Root) crown

words.def: describes roots that are thread-like and normally tough.
words.name: Fibrous

words.def: describes roots that are relatively thick and soft, normally made up of storage tissue. Roots are typically long and thick but not thickly rounded in shape.
words.name: Fleshy

words.def: specialized roots that invade other plants and absorb nutrients from those plants.
words.name: Haustorial

words.def: root tissue that allows plants to regenerate after fire or other damage.
words.name: Lignotuber

words.def: roots that develops from the radicle of the embryo, normally the first root to emerge from the seed as it germinates.
words.name: Primary

words.def: very small roots, often one cell wide, that do most of the water and nutrient absorption.
words.name: Root Hairs

words.def: roots forming off of the primary root, often called branch roots.
words.name: Secondary

words.def: a primary root that more or less enlarges and grows downward into the soil.
words.name: Taproot

words.def: describes roots that are thick and soft, with storage tissue. Typically thick round in shape.
words.name: Tuberous

words.def: an embryonic shoot occurring above or to the side of an axillary bud;also known as supernumerary bud.
words.name: Accessory buds

words.def: produced at the end of a branch.
words.name: Acrocarpous

words.def: a stem that has several longitudinally running ridges with sharp edges.
words.name: Acutangular

words.def: a bud that arises at points on the plant other than at the stem apex or a leaf axil.
words.name: Adventitious buds

words.def: Having wing-like structures, usually on the seeds or stems, as in Euonymus alata
words.name: Alate

words.def: buds are staggered on opposite sides of the branch
words.name: Alternate

words.def: the outer layers of woody plants; cork, phloem, and vascular cambium.
words.name: Bark

words.def: an immature stem tip, typically an embryonic shoot, ether producing a stem, leaves or flowers.
words.name: Bud

words.def: an underground stem normally with a short basal surface and with thick fleshy leaves.
words.name: Bulb

words.def: the hard base produced by herbaceous perennials used to overwinter the plant.
words.name: Caudex

words.def: with a distinctive stem.
words.name: Caulescent

words.def: with the flowers and fruit on the stem or trunk as in Saraca cauliflora
words.name: Cauliflora

words.def: typically long stems, that cling to other objects.
words.name: Climbing

words.def: a compact, upright orientated stem that is bulb-like with hard or fleshy texture and normally covered with papery, thin dry leaves. Most often produced under the soil surface.
words.name: Corm

words.def: a waterproof waxy membrane covering leaves and roots.
words.name: Cuticle

words.def: stems that lie on the ground but have the ends turning upward.
words.name: Decumbent

words.def: a state of no growth or reduced growth
words.name: Dormant

words.def: a layer of cells that cover all primary tissue, separating them from the outside environment.
words.name: Epidermis

words.def: woody stemmed with a shrub-like habit. Branching near the soil with woody based stems.
words.name: Fruticose

words.def: non-woody and dying to the ground at the end of the growing season. Annual plants die, while perennials regrow from parts on the soil surface or below ground the next growing season.
words.name: Herbaceous

words.def: spaces between the nodes.
words.name: Internode

words.def: An axillary bud whose development is inhibited, sometimes for many years, due to the influence of apical and other buds. Also known as a dormant bud.
words.name: Latent buds

words.def: The portion of the annual ring that is formed after formation of earlywood has ceased.
words.name: Late wood

words.def: the photosynthetic organ of a plant that is attached to a stem, generally at specific intervals.
words.name: Leaf

words.def: the space created between a leaf and its branch. This is especially pronounced on monocots like bromeliads.
words.name: Leaf axils

words.def: A bud that produces a leafy shoot.
words.name: Leaf buds

words.def: the mark left on a branch from the previous location of a bud or leaf.
words.name: Leaf scar

words.def: One of the small, corky pores or narrow lines on the surface of the stems of woody plants that allow the interchange of gases between the interior tissue and the surrounding air.
words.name: Lenticel

words.def: where leaves and buds are attached to the stem.
words.name: Node

words.def: growth in a vertical direction.
words.name: Orthotropic growth

words.def: A form of pith in which the parenchyma collapses or is torn during development, leaving the sclerenchyma plates to alternate with hollow zones
words.name: Chambered pith

words.def: Pith in which plates or nests of sclerenchyma may be interspersed with the parenchyma.
words.name: Diaphragmed pith

words.def: an adapted leaf that is usually hard and sharp and is used for protection, and occasionally shading, of the plant
words.name: Spine

words.def: growth inclined away from the vertical, inclined towards the horizontal
words.name: Plagiotropic growth

words.def: an extension of the cortex and epidermis that ends with a sharp point.
words.name: Prickle

words.def: A horizontally orientated, prostrate stem with reduced scale-like leaves, normally growing under ground but also at the soil surface. Also produced by some species that grow in trees or water.
words.name: Rhizome

words.def: the underground part of a plant normally referring to a caudex or rhizome.
words.name: Rootstock

words.def: a stem that climbs.
words.name: Scandent

words.def: the spongy tissue at the center of a stem.
words.name: Pith

words.def: vascular tissue that provides support for the plant,
words.name: Stem

words.def: a horizontally growing stem similar to a rhizome, produced near the base of the plant. They spread out above or along the soil surface. Roots and new plants develop at the nodes or ends.
words.name: Stolon

words.def: Having a corky texture.
words.name: Suberose

words.def: a thigmotropic organ which attaches a climbing plant to a support, a portion of a stem or leaf modified to serve as a holdfast to other objects.
words.name: Tendril

words.def: at the end of a stalk or stem.
words.name: Terminal

words.def: a shoot of a grass plant.
words.name: Tiller

words.def: an enlarged stem or root that stores nutrients.
words.name: Tuber

words.def: swollen.
words.name: Turgid

words.def: buds are arranged in pairs on opposite sides of the branch
words.name: Opposite

words.def: a strand of woody fibers and associated tissues.
words.name: Vascular bundles

words.def: leaves or flowers arranged in whorls, as in Sciadopitys verticillata
words.name: Verticillate/Verticil/Verticillatus

words.def: said of a collection of three or more leaves or flowers that arise from the same point.
words.name: Whorled

words.def: an embryonic shoot occurring above or to the side of an axillary bud; also known as supernumerary bud.
words.name: Accessory bud

words.def: a bud that arises at a point on the plant other than at the stem apex or a leaf axil.
words.name: Adventitious bud

words.def: an embryonic shoot which lies at the junction of the stem and petiole of a plant.
words.name: Axillary

words.def: vegetative buds that lie dormant beneath the bark, shooting after crown disturbance[11]
words.name: Epicormic

words.def: An axillary bud whose development is inhibited, sometimes for many years, due to the influence of apical and other buds. Also known as a dormant bud.
words.name: Latent bud

words.def: A bud that produces a leafy shoot.
words.name: Leaf bud

words.def: buds that have both embryonic flowers and leaves.
words.name: Mixed

words.def: buds with embryonic flowers.
words.name: Reproductive

words.def: buds containing embryonic leaves.
words.name: Vegetative

words.def: see lamina
words.name: Blade

words.def: the flat and laterally-expanded portion of a leaf blade
words.name: Lamina

words.def: a separate blade among others comprising a compound leaf
words.name: Leaflet

words.def: a projection from the top of the sheath on the adaxial side of the sheath-blade joint in grasses
words.name: Ligule

words.def: the central vein of the leaf blade
words.name: Midrib

words.def: the central vein of a leaflet
words.name: Midvein

words.def: a leaf stalk supporting a blade and attaching to a stem at a node
words.name: Petiole

words.def: the swollen base of a petiole or petiolule usually involved in leaf movements and leaf orientation
words.name: Pulvinus

words.def: a secondary axis of a multiply compound leaf
words.name: Rachilla

words.def: main axis of a pinnately compound leaf
words.name: Rachis

words.def: the proximal portion of a grass leaf usually surrounding the stem
words.name: Sheath

words.def: paired scales, spines, glands, or blade-like structures at the base of a petiole
words.name: Stipules

words.def: paired scales, spines, glands, or blade-like structures at the base of a petiolule
words.name: Stipels

words.def: resembling stipules.
words.name: Stipuloid

words.def: lasting for a short time: soon falling away from the parent plant.
words.name: Fugacious

words.def: dead leaves, calyx or petals are persistent, retained
words.name: Marcescent

words.def: see Marcescence
words.name: Persistent

words.def: when the veins run parallel to the leaf edge and fuse at the leaf tip.
words.name: Acrodromous

words.def: when the main veins of a leaf radiate from the tip of the petiole.
words.name: Actinodromous

words.def: the veins turn away from the leaf edge to join the next higher vein.
words.name: Brochidodromous

words.def: with secondary veins that diverge at the base of the lamina and rejoin at the tip.
words.name: Campylodromous

words.def: forked, dividing into two divergent branches.
words.name: Furcate

words.def: veins interconnected to form a network. Net-veined.
words.name: Reticulate

words.def: the externally visible vascular bundles, found on leaves, petals and other parts.
words.name: Vein

words.def: a small vein.
words.name: Veinlet

words.def: three or more leaves or branches or pedicels arising from the same node.
words.name: Whorl

words.def: a compound leaf without a terminal leaflet.
words.name: Abruptly pinnate

words.def: the leaf base wraps around the stem, but not completely.
words.name: Semiamplexicaul

words.def: narrowing to a point, used for other structures too.
words.name: Acuminate

words.def: with acute leaves.
words.name: Acutifolius

words.def: tapering gradually to a narrow end.
words.name: Attenuate

words.def: with shallow, small rounded teeth.
words.name: Crenulate

words.def: being prickly.
words.name: Acanceous

words.def: a prickle or spine.
words.name: Acantha

words.def: fruits are spiny.
words.name: Acanthocarpus

words.def: the branches are spiny.
words.name: Acanthocladous

words.def: having spine-like processes.
words.name: Aculeolate

words.def: gland like.
words.name: Adenoid

words.def: a stalk that supports a gland.
words.name: Adenophore

words.def: leaves with glands.
words.name: Adenophyllous

words.def: having a cobwebby appearance with entangled hairs.
words.name: Arachnoid

words.def: the waxy coating that covers some plants.
words.name: Bloom

words.def: with gray pubescence.
words.name: Canescent

words.def: with a fringe of marginal hairs.
words.name: Ciliate

words.def: with a tough or leathery texture.
words.name: Coriaceouse

words.def: finely cut into fringes, the edge of a frilly petal or leaf.
words.name: Fimbriate

words.def: smooth without any pubescences at all.
words.name: Glabrous

words.def: covered across the surface with glands.
words.name: Glandular-punctate

words.def: with long shaggy hairs, often stiff or bristly to the touch.
words.name: Hirsute

words.def: with woolly hairs. Thick wool like hairs.
words.name: Lanate

words.def: with a wart surface, with low rounded bumps.
words.name: Verrucose

words.def: villous indument.
words.name: Villosity

words.def: Growing larger after anthesis, normally used for the calyx.
words.name: Accrescent

words.def: the period when the flower is fully open and functional, ends when the stigma or stamens wither.
words.name: Anthesis

words.def: attached by the base.
words.name: Basifixed

words.def: the part of the stamen joining the anther cells.
words.name: Connective

words.def: united by filaments to form two groups
words.name: Diadelphous

words.def: having four stamens in two pairs of unequal length
words.name: Didynamous

words.def: born on the corolla, often used in reference to stamens attached to the corolla.
words.name: Epipetalous

words.def: sticking out past the corolla, the stamens protrude past the margin of the corolla lip.
words.name: Exserted

words.def: opening towards the outside of the flower.
words.name: Extrose

words.def: combined male & female structure
words.name: Gynandrium

words.def: adnation of stamens and the style and stigma (Orchidaceae)
words.name: Gynostegium

words.def: opening on the inside of the corolla, the stamens are contained within the margins of the petals.
words.name: Introrse

words.def: stamen filaments united into a tube.
words.name: Monodelphous

words.def: anthers opening by terminal pores.
words.name: Poricidal

words.def: (1) concerning a sterile stamen (2) flowers with sterile stamens.
words.name: Staminodial

words.def: the anthers are connected (Araceae)
words.name: Synandrous

words.def: the anthers are united into a tube, the filaments are free (Asteraceae).
words.name: Syngenesious

words.def: having six stamens four of which are longer than the others
words.name: Tetradynamous

words.def: a structure uniting the pollinia in Asclepiadaceae and Orchidaceae.
words.name: Translator

words.def: pollen containing three nuclei when shed.
words.name: Trinucleate

words.def: anthers opening by valves or small flaps, e.g. Berberis.
words.name: Valvular

words.def: anthers pivoting freely on the filament.
words.name: Versatile

words.def: the distal end of the stamen where pollen is produced, normally composed of two parts called anther-sacs and pollen-sacs (thecae).
words.name: Anther

words.def: the stalk of a stamen
words.name: Filament

words.def: the gynoecium comprises more than one pistil.
words.name: Apocarpus

words.def: the stalk that connects the ovule to the placenta.
words.name: Funicle

words.def: the cavities located within a carpel, ovary or anther.
words.name: Loculus

words.def: the gynoecium comprises one pistil.
words.name: Syncarpous

words.def: Sessile - absent style
words.name: Stigma

words.def:
Position is relative to the body of the ovary.[12]

Terminal or apical: arising at the apex of the ovary (commonest)
Subapical: arising from the side of the ovary just below the apex
Lateral: arising from the side of the ovary, lower than subapical
Gynobasic: arising from the base of the ovary
words.name: Style

words.def: without a head, used for flower styles without a well-developed stigma.
words.name: Acephalous

words.def: the leaf-like or scale-like leafy appendages that are located just below a flower, a flower stalk, or an inflorescence; they usually are reduced in size and sometimes showy or brightly colored.
words.name: Bract

words.def: the whorl of sepals at the base of a flower, the outer whorl of the perianth.
words.name: Calyx

words.def: the ovule-producing reproductive organ of a flower, consisting of the stigma, style and ovary.
words.name: Carpel

words.def: a noticeably narrowed and attenuate organ base, typically a petal. Viola.
words.name: Claw

words.def: when the same parts of a flower are fused to each other, petals in a gamopetalous flower. Petunia.
words.name: Connate

words.def: the whorl of petals of a flower.
words.name: Corolla

words.def: an additional structure between the petals and the stamens.
words.name: Corona

words.def: an enlargement or outgrowth from the receptacle of the flower, located at the center of the flower of various plants. The term is also use as the central area of the head in composites where the tubular flowers are attached.
words.name: Disk

words.def: a series of bracts below the calyx
words.name: Epicalyx

words.def: a structure contain all the seeds produced by a single flower.
words.name: Fruit

words.def: a fluid produce by nectaries high in sugar content, used to attract pollinators.
words.name: Nectar

words.def: a gland that secrets nectar, most often found in flowers but also produced on other parts of plants too.
words.name: Nectary

words.def: when the floral disk contains nectar secreting glands, often modified as its main function in some flowers.
words.name: Nectar disk

words.def: the stem or stalk that holds a single flower in an inflorescence.
words.name: Pedicel

words.def: referring to or having a peduncle.
words.name: Peduncular

words.def: having a peduncle.
words.name: Pedunculate

words.def: without a perianth.
words.name: Achlamydeous

words.def: the end of the pedicel that joins to the flower were the different parts of the flower are joined together, also called the torus. In Asteraceae the top of the pedicel upon which the flowers are joined.
words.name: Receptacle

words.def: when the stamens are the same number as the corolla segments and oppositely arranged the corolla segments. Primula.
words.name: Antipetalous

words.def: when the stamens are the same number as the calyx segments and oppositely arranged the calyx segments.
words.name: Antisepalouse

words.def: the flowers are arranged into a head composed of many separate unstalked flowers, the single flowers are called florets and are packed close together. The typical arrangement of flowers in the Asteraceae.
words.name: Capitulum

words.def: is an umbel where each stalk of the main umbel produces another smaller umbel of flowers.
words.name: Compound Umbel

words.def: a grouping of flowers where all the flowers are at the same level, the flower stalks of different lengths forming a flat-topped flower cluster.
words.name: Corymb

words.def: is a cluster of flowers were the end of each growing point produces a flower. New growth comes from side shoots and the oldest and first flowers to bloom are at the top.
words.name: Cyme

words.def: one flower per stem or the flowers are greatly spread-apart as to appear they do not arise from the same branch.
words.name: Single

words.def: when flowers arising from the main stem are without individual flower stalks. The flowers attach directly to the stem.
words.name: Spike

words.def: same as single, with one flower per stem.
words.name: Solitary

words.def: is a flower spike with flowers that have stalks of equal length. The stem tip continues to grow and produce more flowers with the bottom flowers open first and blooming progresses up the stem.
words.name: Raceme

words.def: is a raceme with branches and each branch having a smaller raceme of flowers. The terminal bud of each branch continues to grow, producing more side shoots and flowers.
words.name: Panicle

words.def: stem holding a one flower in an inflorescences.
words.name: Pedicel

words.def: stem holding an inflorescences, or a single flower.
words.name: Peduncle

words.def: were the flower head has all the flower stalks rising from the same point of the same length, the flower head is rounded like an umbrella or almost circular.
words.name: Umbel

words.def: a whorled collection of flowers around the stem, the flowers produced in rings at intervals up the stem. As the stem tip continues to grow more whorls of flowers are produced. Typical in Lamiaceae.
words.name: Verticillaster

words.def: flowers arranged in whorls at the nodes.
words.name: Verticil

words.def: flowers are present above the ovary
words.name: Epigynous

words.def: flowers are present below the ovary
words.name: Hypogynous

words.def: term used for the lateral petals of the flowers on species in Fabaceae and Polygalaceae.
words.name: Wing

words.def: meeting along the margins but not overlapping.
words.name: Valvate

words.def: the androecium with the stamen filaments partly or completely fused together.
words.name: Adelphous

words.def: a flower without petals.
words.name: Apetalous

words.def: of a flower, having all the possible parts represented, thus sepals, petals, stamens, and pistils.[13]
words.name: Complete

words.def: describes a plant species or population that has some plants that are female and some plants that are hermaphrodites.
words.name: Gynodioecy

words.def: when the flower anthers and the stigma are ripe at the same time.
words.name: Homogamous

words.def: of a flower or inflorescence, being unisexual and developing organs of only a single sex.[13]
words.name: Imperfect

words.def: possessing both stamens and ovary (male and female parts)
words.name: Perfect

words.def: when the flower parts are arranged with radial symmetry.
words.name: Actinomorphy

words.def: Symmetric when bisected from any angle (circular)
words.name: Radial

words.def: the type of symmetry that most irregular flowers have with the upper half of the flower unlike the lower half. the left and right halves tend to be mirror images of each other.
words.name: Zygomorphy

words.def: cross pollination, when one plant pollinates another plant
words.name: Allogamy

words.def: wind pollinated.
words.name: Anemophilous

words.def: self-pollination, when the flowers of the same plant pollinate flowers on the same plant or themselves.
words.name: Autogamy

words.def: beetle pollinated
words.name: Cantharophilous

words.def: bat pollinated.
words.name: Chiropterophilous

words.def: self-pollination of a flower that does not open.
words.name: Cleistogamous

words.def: Flowers that cannot pollinate themselves because pollen is produced at a time when the stigmas are not receptive of pollen.
words.name: Dichogamy

words.def: insect pollinated.
words.name: Entomophilous

words.def: Water pollinated, pollen is moved in water from one flower to the next.
words.name: Hydrophilous

words.def: pollinated by snails and slugs.
words.name: Malacophilous

words.def: pollinated by birds.
words.name: Ornithophilous

words.def: the movement of pollen from the anther to the stigma.
words.name: Pollination

words.def: when pollen is produced and shed before the carpels are mature.
words.name: Protandrous

words.def: when the carpels mature before the stamens produce pollen.
words.name: Progynous

words.def: protective sheathe on SAM
words.name: Coleoptile

words.def: protecting layer of a seed
words.name: Coleorhiza

words.def: Initial root-determined cells (Root apical meristem)
words.name: Radicle

words.def: a fleshy seed coat
words.name: Sarcotesta

words.def: a hard seed coat
words.name: Sclerotesta

words.def: the effect of pollen on seeds and fruit
words.name: Xenia

words.def: parts of fruits that do not form from the ovary.
words.name: Accessory structures

words.def: normally the slender elongated end of a fruit, typically a persistent style-base.
words.name: Beak

words.def: a type of fruit dehiscences were the top of the fruit falls away like a lid or covering.
words.name: Circumscissile

words.def: the way a fruit openings and releases its contents, normally in a regular and distinctive fashion.
words.name: Dehiscent

words.def: includes the wall of the seed chamber, the inner part of the pericarp.
words.name: Endocarp

words.def: the pericarp's outer part.
words.name: Exocarp

words.def: fruits that do not have specialized structures for opening and releasing the seeds, they remain closed after the seeds ripen and are opened by animals, weathering, fire or other external means.
words.name: Indehiscent

words.def: the middle layer of the pericarp.
words.name: Mesocarp

words.def: the body of the fruit from its outside surface to the chamber were the seeds are, including the outside skin of the fruit and the inside lining of the seed chamber.
words.name: Pericarp

words.def: the seam along which the fruit opens, normally in most fruits it is where the carpel or carpels are fused together.
words.name: Suture

words.def: one of the segments of the capsule.
words.name: Valve

words.def: see achene.
words.name: Achaenocarp

words.def: dry indehiscent fruit, they have one seed and form from a single carpel, the seed is distinct from the fruit wall.
words.name: Achene

words.def: the pericarp and seed are fused together, the fruit of many grasses.[15]
words.name: Caryopsis

words.def: outer fleshy part surrounds a shell with a seed inside.
words.name: Drupe

words.def: a dry dehiscent fruit containing many seeds.[14] Examples include follicles, dehiscent capsules, and many but not all legumes.
words.name: Pod (seedpod)

words.def: a fruit formed from a pistil with multiple carpels and having a woody covering. e.g. hickory, pecan, and oak.
words.name: Nut

words.def: A small nut.
words.name: Nutlet

words.def: accessory fruit from one or more carpels, specific to the apple and some related genera in the family Rosaceae
words.name: Pome

words.def: winged achene, e.g. maples.
words.name: Samara

words.def: a small inflated fruit with one seed that has thin walls. Fruits are usually one-seeded. Some species of amaranth.
words.name: Utricle

words.def: having several fused sori.
words.name: Acrostichoid sorus

words.def: outer part of sporangium
words.name: Annulus

words.def: a group or cluster of sporangia borne abaxially on a fern frond.[13]
words.name: Sorus / Sori

words.def: used for moss species that have antheridia at the top of the stem.
words.name: Acrandrous

words.def: In liverworts, the female sex organs terminate the main shoot
words.name: Acrogynous

words.def: In liverworts, female sex organs are produced by a lateral cell, thus the growth of the main shoot is indeterminate
words.name: Anacrogynous

words.def: male sex organ
words.name: Androecium

words.def: Monoicous, and producing both types of sex organs together.
words.name: Androgynous

words.def: A specialised branch that bears the antheridia in the Marchantiales
words.name: Antheridiophore

words.def: A specialised branch that bears the archaegonia in the Marchantiales
words.name: Archegoniophore

words.def: Produces male and female sex organs on the same plant but on separate inflorescences
words.name: Autoicous

words.def: leaf is present below the flower
words.name: Bract

words.def: Male and female inflorescences on separate branches of the same plant
words.name: Cladautoicous

words.def: Having two forms of gametophyte, one form bearing antheridia and one form bearing archegonia.
words.name: Dioicous

words.def: Male is bud-like in the axil of a female branch
words.name: Gonioautoicous

words.def: describing the arrangement of leaves of a liverwort, contrast with succubous
words.name: Incubous

words.def: cluster of flower
words.name: Inflorescence

words.def: A tube of thallus tissue that protects the archegonia
words.name: Involucre

words.def: Having a single form of gametophyte bearing both antheridia and archegonia, either together or on separate branches.
words.name: Monoicous

words.def: Sterile hairs surrounding the archegonia and antheridia
words.name: Paraphyses

words.def: A protective tube that surrounds the archegonia, characterises the Jungermannialean liverworts
words.name: Perianth

words.def: The cluster of leaves with the enclosed female sex organs
words.name: Perichaetium

words.def: The cluster of leaves with the enclosed male sex organs
words.name: Perigonium

words.def: Dwarf male plants growing on living leaves of female plants
words.name: Pseudautoicous

words.def: An involucre that resembles a perianth, but is made of thallus tissue, and usually forms after the sporophyte develops
words.name: Pseudoperianth

words.def: Male inflorescence attached to the female stem by rhizoids
words.name: Rhizautoicous

words.def: describing the arrangement of leaves of a liverwort, contrast with incubous
words.name: Succubous

words.def: Male and female sex organs on the same gametophyte but are not clustered
words.name: Synoicous

words.def: The external cell layers of the developing sporangium of a bryophyte. (Note: this term is also used in the mycology of lichens.)
words.name: Amphithecium

words.def: Anisospore production is a rare condition in dioecious bryophytes; meiosis produces two small spores that develop into male gametophytes and two larger spores that develop into female gametophytes; contrast Isosporous.
words.name: Anisosporous

words.def: structures derived from the sporangium of liverworts that aid in spore dispersal
words.name: Elater

words.def: unlike anisosporous species, whether monoecious or dioecious, all spores are the same size.
words.name: Isosporous

words.def: structures derived from the sporangium of hornworts that aid in spore dispersal
words.name: Pseudoelater
